reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went along to Lulworth a fortnight ago and had an amazingly restful time and great experience at this hotel. The people who worked there were fantastically helpful and friendly - the food was great (the sole in particular was fantastic) and great portions, although you have to still force down the sticky toffee pudding, you really do.
reviews.title: What a relaxing breaK!

likes.disliked: — Bathroom could have been a little more modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was obviously busy whilst we were there but never noisy, the food in the restaurant came in good time etc. The hotel doesn't permit young children which also adds to the air of tranquility (sorry little ones, no offense intended).
reviews.title: fantastic location and perfect food.

likes.disliked: — parking in main carpark 2 minutes walk away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The surroundings are heavenly and there is plenty to do if you want to get out and about. If, like I did, you need to recharge and get in touch with the brighter side of life, without any pretensious hotels and tacky gift shops/nightlife etc - this is the place to go.
reviews.title: A Weekend to Remember

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in room 21 which has a lovely seaview from the room and large balcony. The room is a reasonable size, has everything you might need and has been recently, decorated very tastefully. The staff are helpful and efficient. Breakfast and Dinner was delicious, quite pricey but could not be faulted. We felt the price of the room good value for the attractive location. This is a great place for walking as long as you can manage pretty steep hills. Overall a great place for a few days away and we'll certainly be returning.
reviews.title: Good break away

reviews.text: We booked the hotel from the website for our quiet weekend break and were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Bring you own hot water + heater!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be warned....most of the reviews for this hotel seem to have been written by guests who by an amazing coincidence stayed in room 21 or 22.....which sound heavenly. Their description does not resemble the experience I had in a Standard Double, which like many of the rooms, faces a patch of grass, the oil tank and a wall. As I looked out, a rather sad and lonely dalmation looked back from her chilly kennel - I am not sure who was more miserable - her or me.
reviews.title: Misleading website - don't be fooled
Even getting to stay there is frustrating!
reviews.text: Whilst the staff were all charming and the restaurant area attractive, the breakfast was only just ok. Poor quality sausages, cheap bacon, toast made from packet sliced bread and jam etc served in plastic catering portion-control packs. Fresh ground coffee improved matters slightly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However the real downer about this place is the poor quality of the postage stamp sized bedrooms. I have not been in a more depressing hotel room all year. Low ceilings, no room for even one chair, valances that do not fit the bed and the cheapest of cheap flimsy and heavily marked furniture. Tiny wall-mounted portable TV with a non-functioning remote control. The walls are made of cardboard - so take ear plugs if you don't relish the sound of your neighbours flushing the loo or don't wish to participate in their conversations. It seems that someone has taken up the challenge to build and furnish these rooms as cheaply as can be.
reviews.title: Good Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The postage stamp sized shower room is decorated with tiles that your granny might have chosen in 1972. There is no shelf for towels (presented balanced on loo lid) or even a soap dish in the shower for the soap and shampoo. The shower door is rusty around the edges and another cheap and tacky addition to the overall experience.
reviews.title: Lovely Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The real problem with all of this is that the experience simply does not resemble the very attractive beachy, surfy lifestyle image presented by the good website. Worst of all it is just terrible value. £85 a night. I honestly would have turned around and checked out immediately once I saw my room - except the cunning owners take a night's accommodation as a deposit - so they have you trapped....There are loads of other B&Bs/hotels in this area and I am sure most are better than this and probably more competitively priced. Avoid.
reviews.title: Good food but small moldy room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading previous reviews we were a bit dubiuos about our stay at this hotel. We booked room 21, which is the 'best' room available. The room had the most amazing view over the cove complete with a balcony. The room was nice, there were a few things which could have been improved, just little things but what you'd expect for the money you are paying. For example, the blinds were broken and slightly hanging off the walls, one of the chairs on the balcony was broken leaving just one for 2 of us to sit on! It was also not very soundproof and we were woken in the morning by voices outside of other guests. But generally it was a nice room. The breakfast was really really nice thought and the restuarant was a nice setting and atmosphere. We didn't eat in there at night as it was slightly pricy, but if anything like the breakfast i'm sure it would have been worth the money. The staff were all friendly, inparticular a young lady from Australia who served us at btrekfast and delat with our check out.
reviews.title: better than we expected!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm surprised by the poor reviews for this place; I've just had a two night stay with my fiance and we were pleasantly surprised having read previous reviews before we went.
reviews.title: Lovely break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room (21) was more than big enough, the bathroom could have done with a coat of paint but other than that it was totally adequate. At £95 per night it is a bit on the pricey side but you're paying for the location which cant be faulted (30 seconds from the cove). The breakfast was good and service on the whole was speedy and attentive, particularly the Aussie waitress who is a real asset.
reviews.title: Don't be fooled by the website

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all then, its not the cheapest place and its not the plushest but you get great service and an unbeatable location with a decent bedroom to relax in after that walk to Durdle door
reviews.title: Dirty, Cold, and Rude!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A thoroughly disappointing stay and shame on the owners for portraying the hotel as luxury accomodation on its website. The room was pokey, the main light didn't work and you knocked your head on poorly positioned bedside lights if you sat up in bed. A damp bathroom meant that your towels, which the hotel maids hung to dry over the shower curtain rail, were still wet when you returned to your room at the end of the day. There was no shelf in the bathroom so you had to balance your toothbrush and other toiletries on the dated shell-effect sink.
reviews.title: Two more disappointed customers

reviews.text: The location of this hotel was good for visiting the area, but the room we stayed was in need of repair. Although large with several sofas, the bathroom required significant work and the decor was suffering from want of attention.
reviews.title: Poor room?

reviews.text: Stayed one night in the annex above the bistro.
reviews.title: good location but little else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spacious rooms had been 'upgraded' with little more than cosmetic paint. The mattress was tired and uncomfortable; we did not choose to look under the sheet.
reviews.title: Dont bother

reviews.text: A grumpy manageress of the Bistro downstairs failed to hide her distain and arrogance towards us, which created a sour note. I would not like to use these rooms when the Bistro was open- we could hear the staff's music very clearly.
reviews.title: lack of care

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: These rooms were more expensive than in the main house so I guess they should be better.
reviews.title: Could be amazing...but sadly isn't at the moment
